title: Suddenlink Issues
body:
Folks,

We have been in touch with Suddenlink the past few days and an issue has been identified that impacted all players who were routing via the Dallas POP. We have temporarily disabled this interconnect with them until they can rectify the underlying problem which may result in a slight ping increase but greater stability. I'll update this thread when we have been advised they are ready to restore normal connectivity.

replies.body: please look at my board to see the videos i have posted about the lag. I can't play because of it and i have go through the 20 min ques (5 games) 3 times because of this lag >.>. Here is one of my videos, as i have said many times i keep 60 FPS and 30-60 ping but it "jumps" and does this. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hV-yfN-JY6g
The underlying issue is not fixed - we have just routed around it as much as we can for now.

Korensky,

Just to chime in my ping is now a more stable 50.  Which is leaps and bounds better than the 150-300 I was having.  I guess there is no time for Fallout tonight!
Same here, back to 50 again which is far preferable to the ~300+ I was seeing last night.
I really need some help from riot because my ISP won't answer anything i have asked...
I am still experiencing this issue.  Players from other regions say its stable, I am not experiencing that.

Better than nothing, thank you for looking into this problem as far as you could and keeping us updated. I also can confirm my ping isn't 200-300 anymore, like the others have posted too. My ping used to be around 40-ish but I'll even take 45-50 which is way less than what I had before the servers moved (90-ish) so definitely playable. Appreciate it a lot.
Thank you so much for letting us know you are doing gods work!

We have made some additional routing changes this morning and we are in contact with the Suddenlink NOC waiting on the underlying cause to be resolved. They have not been able to provide us with any detail on how long it will take for them to finish the work needed.

Thanks for working on this and keeping us updated on the developments Korensky. 

With the free time from League I might actually be able to finish Fallout 4!

> [{quoted}](name=Korensky,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2016-01-21T17:53:10.027+0000)
>
> We have made some additional routing changes this morning and we are in contact with the Suddenlink NOC waiting on the underlying cause to be resolved. They have not been able to provide us with any detail on how long it will take for them to finish the work needed.

Thanks for this. Back to ~60. Also been poking Suddenlink to try and get them to speed up a bit on it.
Thanks for the update and continual updates and efforts on your end.
don't blame riot, blame suddenlink, the worst telecom service in the US when it comes to competitive high speed internet. Cant wait for Google Fiber to come to my area
I am a Missouri suddenlink user with very similar issues. Am I being affected by the dallas server? I am curious if this server is hitting all suddenlink users.
Probably. I'm in SWMO and I am running around 150-200 ping tonight (typically 30-45)
im in KY with sudden link and mine is staying right around 200 for the last day or so only on LOL tho, hopefully it'll help mine i got used to 25-35 ping this 200 making it horrible to play.

I'm guessing this explains my ping going from ~40 to ~250-300 on Suddenlink just outside Dallas.

It's fairly unplayable right now. I certainly wouldn't characterise it as a "slight" ping increase, either.
Greater stability? My ping is all over the place...
Thanks for looking into it. Here's hoping it gets fixed soon!
Thank you!

> [{quoted}](name=Korensky,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-01-20T18:41:35.469+0000)

We have temporarily disabled this interconnect with them until they can rectify the underlying problem which may result in a slight ping increase but greater stability. I'll update this thread when we have been advised they are ready to restore normal connectivity.

Hey, a bit of wisdom i'm sending your way: You probably want to pin this thread at the top of the boards so it doesn't disappear in the sea of threads.
What about for us who have ping problems and random disconnects throughout the game but are not with Suddenlink. Myself and others have had this problem and it started Saturday.

> [{quoted}](name=Kaiser Noah,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-01-20T18:56:32.480+0000)
>
> What about for us who have ping problems and random disconnects throughout the game but are not with Suddenlink. Myself and others have had this problem and it started Saturday.

This will be a separate issue. Please try and contact player support if your ISP is unable to assist and they will help you to diagnose the problem. This particular problem only impacts Suddenlink and any other ISP that they provide services to who transit this location in Dallas.

> [{quoted}](name=Kaiser Noah,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-20T19:08:58.949+0000)
>
> :(

I've pulled your stats and your connection is pretty much perfect right now. If it is worse in the evening then your ISP is running things too hot and needs to look at their capacity planning.
It gets just a lil bit worse. It may be on your guy's end because Iv met like 5 players in game having the same issue. So I dont know why their capacity planning would suddenly start being awful.

> [{quoted}](name=Kaiser Noah,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-20T19:21:43.849+0000)
>
> It gets just a lil bit worse. It may be on your guy's end because Iv met like 5 players in game having the same issue. So I dont know why their capacity planning would suddenly start being awful.

It wouldn't be an issue on Riot's end; they just run their own servers. It sounds like the issue is with your ISP (or multiple ISPs) with peak traffic and their ability to manage those loads. It's best to contact your ISP if you encounter further issues with a Tracert to Riot's servers.

tl;dr: think roads and destination. If there's traffic, you'll move more slowly to the destination. With the way that the servers are set up, it's unlikely that the bottleneck will occur at the server and more likely along the route.

Fix Frontier as well.  

  8    42 ms    42 ms    42 ms  ae1---0.cbr01.chcg.il.frontiernet.net [74.40.4.142] 
  9   174 ms   191 ms   187 ms  eqix-ch2.chi01.riotdirect.net [206.223.119.235] 
 10   417 ms   409 ms   437 ms  104.160.131.44 
 11    84 ms     *       73 ms  104.160.131.101 

Standard is 45 ping, after 6pm it is 400+.  My ping is fine on all games, even on other League servers, speedtests, pingtests, and net analyzer.

Pls fix.  I submitted everything for roit support.  

HALP MEH

Just because your trace-route program is being ridiculous doesn't mean you're actually going through Europe. Your trace completed in less than 20ms which would be impossible if your traffic actually went from Arizona to Europe then back to Chicago. 20ms is really good so I'm not sure what you're complaining about anyway.

umm idk who you are.. you just created an account to post here, your lvl 2

and the trace competed in 8.753 SECONDS... NOT milliseconds

plus as i have posted in countless other threads.

i dont have 20 ms ping.. if i DID i wouldn't BE here.

however my ping goes anywhere from 66 (which is also fine) but then jumps to to 230.. for 40 min at a time which IS unplayable. and becuase i can happen mid way through a game it completely stops me from playing ranked. 

PLUS the fact that telia ONLY operates in Europe and asia.. that fact it is even HITTING there servers is a blatantly obvious indication it leaving north america

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telia_Company

I'll help you with learning how to read Open Visual Trace Route (OVTR) since it isn't as user friendly as most other trace-route programs. The path latency is in the Latency column and is seen on the last hop. For yours it is hop 12 and shows 15 ms. This particular trace-route program does a lot more than just trace-route such as pull rDNS and GeoLocation Data. The "Trace Route Completed" at the bottom is a combined time of all of those services together. This does not mean your connection is bad. rDNS can take time to load. GeoLocation data is horribly inaccurate (which is why it shows Europe) and often shows wrong data, not to mention it takes time to get that bad data. If you run a ping at the same time your ping will match the last hop in the OVTR trace, latency column, as seen here: http://i.imgur.com/fQBlFT6.png

Telia does not just operate in Europe. Here is their network Map. Enjoy these actual facts: http://www.teliacarriermap.com/. 

However, now that you posted a trace that showed an actual problem, your WinMTR shows high latency at hop 1 and it continues to the destination. What is INTEL_CE_LINUX and why does it have 174ms latency?

> [{quoted}](name=IS17d1078bfb673366dcde2,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=0014000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-16T00:42:23.598+0000)

my questions is why is yours going from 173.219.254.48 still in suddenlink
directly to santa monica

when mine is going to the telia network.
if suddenlink can route you directly there with its own network.. why cant it route me there directly within its own network, why is it handing me off to telia. which pretty much seems to be the issue..

> [{quoted}](name=SwiftKitten88,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=00140000000000000001,timestamp=2016-09-17T18:17:18.507+0000)

> if suddenlink can route you directly there with its own network.. why cant it route me there directly within its own network, why is it handing me off to telia. which pretty much seems to be the issue..

When looking for latency, you start at the end of the trace and if you see latency, you follow it back to where it starts. Yours starts at hop 1, which is your router at your home, at least in your latest traces. Fix that first then move on to the next problem. A problem on Telia's network would not cause your router to have high latency.

> [{quoted}](name=IS17d1078bfb673366dcde2,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9vFN4njE,comment-id=001400000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-09-17T22:16:53.656+0000)

> When looking for latency, you start at the end of the trace and if you see latency, you follow it back to where it starts. Yours starts at hop 1, which is your router at your home, at least in your latest traces. Fix that first then move on to the next problem. A problem on Telia's network would not cause your router to have high latency.

yes but when it does spike on my router its only for about 1 or 2 seconds.. and i have NEVER seen happen in game.

however if telia spikes, the spike lasts between 20 min and 2 hours...

so I'm much more concerned about THAT spike.. than a lone 1-2 second spike from my router

So you just happen to catch your trace during the 1-2 second spike? Your open visual trace did not show any problems. Your 3rd trace you showed only showed a problem between telia and riot as the latency did not exist until that hop. 

As far as the location of the traces, you're putting too much emphasis into rdns and geoip. Neither of our traces are actually going through Santa Monica. Riot's NA servers are in Chicago (http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Servers) but Riot HQ used to be in Santa Monica and old databases have not updated their junk. (http://www.polygon.com/2015/4/21/8464489/riot-games-new-league-of-legends-offices-la)

a few days ago i got 3 games in a row with constant 66 ping and i thought the issue was gone... then the next game i was fine for about 8 min then the ping rose to 200-250 for little over and hour.. then died down again back to 66 as if nothing had happened

there was absolutely no warning, just randomly the game becomes completely unplayable.

for example.. right now i can rune a traceroute and for the most part its fine.... but i still get random spikes of ping

which is fine as long as they are small. and go back down

and my apartment is quite literally a quarter of a mjile from the suddenlink office.  idk of that is where the hub is, but if it is then it seems like would be very odd to see an increase in ping between w/e INTEL_CE_LINUX and the suddenlink office

but even then the high ping seems to start from suddenlink here

so.. i really have no idea what is going on.

either way the end telia hop (dls-b21-link.telia.net) pretty hop much always causes some sort of issue with my ping

either way.. sometime my ping is fine at 66, other times it goes crazy skyrocking upwards to over 200 for periods of time over an hours

but even when i run a speed test i can ping an LA server

and get 28 ping.

so.. considering that even though 66 is perfectly fine  and i am more than happy to play on that

but again 66 ping is more than fine i dont care about that.. what i care about is when it randomly spikes

and although i still belive suddenlink is certainly part of the issue.. i am now starting to believe that riot is bigger part of the issue than they are leading me to believe.

Your normal trace shows that 1INTEL_CE_LINUX resolves to [192.168.0.1] which is going to be the router at your home. Try bypassing it for a few hours and keep running your trace. That will eliminate that from the path and may give you a clearer picture as to what is going on. It will at minimum get that one dirty hop out of your traces.

I'd like to rehash this issue and point out that just about every night around similar times my ping shoots up to a minimum 225 and sometimes its over 500. It varies as far as when it starts in the evening so I dont know if I can play a game and it will be okay or if it has started messing up already for that night. I do have Suddenlink as an ISP and I live in Arizona,  I'm not sure where exactly my signal is routed but Texas sounds like a likely option. I know you guys have worked long and hard on these problems but something has to give man. When I'm getting low priority queues over something thats not in my control I have a problem. I've spent a pretty substantial amount of money on this game and I would like to be able to play it.
